result.execSummary:
The defendant Tiffani L. Rizzio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: To pay costs-only including $30 in drug testing fees [clerk's calculation listed on the payment slip: $443 plus $30.] The Court grants Ms. Rizzio sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in sixty days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

[MK] cases #15CM453 and #15CM455 called at 3:59pm. 
Co-Defendant Tiffani L. Rizzio in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.
Co-Defendant Jerry Lusic in court with Attorney Stephen Kramer. 
ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case #15CM455:
ADA Hall indicates that Ms. Rizzio has successfully completed the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.   
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #3.  
On Motion of the State, the Court enters Judgment of Conviction on Amended Count #2, and the Court sentences Ms. Rizzio to pay costs-only including $30 in drug testing fees [clerk's calculation listed on the payment slip: $443 plus $30.] The Court grants Ms. Rizzio sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in sixty days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive. 
-------------------------------------------------------
As to Case #15CM453:
ADA Hall indicates that Mr. Lusic has not been successful in completing the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  On agreement of the parties, the Court orders extension of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and all of its conditions for nine months. This will allow time for Mr. Lusic to complete AODA treatment and be subject to further drug tests.
recess 4:05pm
Sentencing hearing on September 22, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on September 22, 2017 at 09:30 am.

[MK] cases #15CM453 and #15CM455 called at 3:43pm. 
Co- Defendant Jerry E Lusic in court with Attorney Stephen R Kramer.  
Co-Defendant Tiffani L. RIzzio in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.
ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On Motion of the State, the Court amends Case #15CM455 count #2 to be a violation of Statute #961.41(3g)(e).

The Court reviews the proposed Deferred Prosecution Agreement with each of the Defendants, verifying that they understand and join in the agreement. 
Constitutional rights reviewed
Mr. Lusic enters a plea of "No Contest" on Count #1 
Ms. Rizzio enters a plea of "No Contest" on Count #2 as Amended " 
Factual basis stipulated in each case. 
The Court the accepts the pleas of each Co-Defendant.  The Court finds each Co-Defendant guilty, and enters a Judgment of Conviction consistent with the charge that each Co-Defendant pled to.  The Court stays the entry ot the Judgment and instead adopts th Deferred Prosecution Agreement in each case. 

The Court grants an adjournment or suspends the proceedings as to the counts to which there had not been any plea entered, with the anticipation that they would be read in and dismissed at the time of the completion of the DPA;  or with the potential that there could be prosecution of those charges if the DPA is revoked.  
The Court clarifies to each Co-Defendant that the Bonds remains in effect through the time period of the Deferred Prosecution Agreements. 
recess 4:05pm 

NEXT:  schedule Sentencing Hearing on both cases together in late September 2017-- but must be no later than September 30, 2017
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on September 30, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial on November 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on November 7, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Case called at 9:02 am [Clerk SH]-15CM453
[Commissioner Jennifer Weber presiding for III]
Defendant Jerry E Lusic in court with Attorney Stephen Richard Kramer. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

On Motion to Modify Bond:
DA Happ informs the Court that the State has no objection to motion as the State did not request the no contact condition of bond
Arguments in support of motion by Atty Kramer

Court presents basis and grants motion to modify bond to eliminate the no contact provision of bond and make it a no discussion of case with Miss Rizio.
Court now calls case 15CM455: 9:07 am Defendant Tiffani L. Rizzio in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CM455:
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court requires a $1000 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
-No possession of drug paraphernalia
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Jerry Lusic
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-Booking at JCSD
-Maintain absolute sobriety

Atty Kramer requests a continued status, so that Mr. Lusic's case can track with Miss Rizio's
Atty Hagemann requests DA PTC and STC
No objection from DA Happ
Recess: 9:14 am
